Authors:
Marie J.J. Huysman, Atsuko Tanaka, Chris Bowler, Wim
Vyverman, Lieven De Veylder
Title:
Functional characterization of the diatom cyclin-dependent
kinase A2 as a mitotic regulator reveals plant-like properties in a
non-green lineage.
Keywords:
Cyclin-dependent kinase, CDKA2, cell cycle, cell division,
cytokinesis, diatom, mitosis, Phaeodactylum tricornutum
Abstract:
Cyclin-dependent kinases (CDKs) are crucial regulators of
cell cycle progression in eukaryotes. The diatom CDKA2 was originally
assigned to the classical A-type CDKs, but its cell cycle phase-specific
transcription at the G2-to-M phase transition is typical for
plant-specific B-type CDKs.
